title: RC circuits - capacitor charge at time 2RC

content.question: A capacitor of capacitance <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi></math>, an open switch, and a resistor of resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> are connected as shown in the figure. The capacitor has an initial charge <math alttext="Q sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> when the switch is closed at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, and charge <math alttext="Q sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> at time <math alttext="t equals 2 R C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi><mi>C</mi></math>. Which of the following is closest to the ratio <math alttext="the fraction Q sub 1 over Q sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mfrac></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
